metadata.synopsis: Jergal's debrief at MOO after the mind flayer colony.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book -> Set quest flags -> Act 2 -> SCE - Epilogue -> Go off-path -> Block Jaheira, Florrick and Minthara -> Start the debrief for his debrief, but he always appears regardless of which path players take.

24.speaker: Withers
24.text: Selûne's light extinguished, thy hunger quenched. The scales tip, weighted by blood thou spilt.

19.speaker: Withers
19.text: Thou hast seen with thine own eyes and felt in thine Urges: the Dead Three unite.

26.speaker: Withers
26.text: The shadows yet fester. The Dead Three, united under cover of darkness. The balance shifts.

104.speaker: Withers
104.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

16.speaker: Player
16.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

103.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *All three sowed chaos at the height of their power. And all three now walk the planes as mortals - or so it's believed.*

22.speaker: Withers
22.text: There are depths to this alliance yet unplumbed. Consider, mortal:

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Forget that. Who are you? What are you doing here?

99.speaker: Withers
99.text: I shall ask yet again. Do illithids possess souls?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I'm not sure. Don't all living things?

102.speaker: Withers
102.text: No. Nor canst thou count mind flayers among them.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I admit I haven't thought about it.

25.speaker: Withers
25.text: Thou shalt think about it now, and I shall give the answer. Mind flayers are soulless.

93.speaker: Withers
93.text: Yet the Three amass an illithid army, void of apostolic souls that could imbue them with power.

40.speaker: Withers
40.text: A flock without souls - yet to what end, O tempted one? This is the question thou must come to answer.

86.speaker: Withers
86.text: Until such time, be availed of my services.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

2.speaker: Withers
2.text: Where matters of balance are concerned, I am eternally called.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

123.speaker: Withers
123.text: There are many answers to those questions. None are important.

1.speaker: Withers
1.text: For sake of convenience, thou shalt call me Withers.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Serving Shar is all I have ever known. What should I do now?

30.speaker: Withers
30.text: Thou knowest the answer to this already. The daughter of Selûne, whose blood thou left unspilled, revealed long-hidden truths. Thou must win back that which was taken.

100.speaker: Withers
100.text: Seek the daughter of Selûne, whose blood thou left unspilled. There are truths yet to be spoken.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You know of these Urges. What can you tell me?

96.speaker: Withers
96.text: Nothing thou dost not already know.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Speak plainly. Isn't there more you can tell me?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Can the Dead Three hope to reclaim full godhood?

14.speaker: Withers
14.text: For the divine appointees of Ao, even death can be overcome.

11.speaker: Withers
11.text: The alliance is reforged, mortal. The planes thus quake, and the gods shudder.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You seem to know a lot about the Dead Three.

56.speaker: Withers
56.text: Yes. Bane, Lord of Darkness. Bhaal, Lord of Murder. Myrkul, Lord of Bones.

65.speaker: Withers
65.text: Once judged, ascended, then vanquished, as one and as three.

10.speaker: Withers
10.text: A mending of the threads between life and death.

31.speaker: Withers
31.text: Should thou or any of thy compatriots perish, I will cleave soul to body once more.

77.speaker: Withers
77.text: Then thou must provide the proper payment.

53.speaker: Withers
53.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

66.speaker: Withers
66.text: Well counted. I recommend keeping thy distance for a moment.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Changed my mind. They can stay dead for now.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I want to resurrect all of my fallen companions. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

117.speaker: Withers
117.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I want to manage my hirelings.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I would like to recruit a hireling. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_3_01f129ea-b4dc-44b6-8154-9a948f876a82])

32.speaker: Withers
32.text: Patience. Thy colleague still peruses my ledger.

44.speaker: Withers
44.text: Patience. Thy colleague still peruses my ledger.

8.speaker: Withers
8.text: Thou canst not hire allies. I must speak with thy leader.

90.speaker: Withers
90.text: One of thy hirelings waits in thy camp.

50.speaker: Withers
50.text: Two of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

45.speaker: Withers
45.text: All three of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

70.text: No. Thy coinpurse is near empty.

69.speaker: Withers
69.text: No. Thy coinpurse is near empty.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I would like to dismiss a hireling.

61.speaker: Withers
61.text: There is no one to dismiss.

55.speaker: Withers
55.text: Only thy leader may banish hirelings.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I would like to change my appearance or class.

122.speaker: Withers
122.text: Thou hast broken thy oath. Before I can aid thee, thou must atone.

105.speaker: Withers
105.text: A flock without souls - yet to what end, mortal? This is the question thou must come to answer.

63.speaker: Withers
63.text: Thy hunger denied. Selûne's faithful yet shines. The balance shifts.

67.speaker: Withers
67.text: One goddess mourns her daughter, slain by thy hand. Yet her sister rejoices in the blood, and bestows honours upon thy head.

73.speaker: Withers
73.text: The Dead Three stand united. Shalt thou have the strength to face them?

71.speaker: Withers
71.text: Fate spins along as it should. Hast thou need of my services?

87.speaker: Withers
87.text: Thou hast angered thy goddess, yet spared the child of another. A curious turn.

121.speaker: Withers
121.text: A curse lifted. The Dead Three, allied once more. The balance shifts.
